intro: Manettia lygistum var. lygistoides, commonly known as the red-veined strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with deep red veins. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
